message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

This paper addresses the problem of spatio-temporal localization of human actions in video, which is a common topic in computer vision and machine learning. The proposed model uses recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to model the temporal structure of actions on the level of person tracks, which is a common approach in computer vision research. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also proposes a novel architecture for the RNNs, which is designed to recognize and localize action classes in time. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which are closely related to the development of new models and algorithms for machine learning. 

The paper evaluates the proposed method on two recent datasets for spatio-temporal action localization, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.RO (Robotics), which are both concerned with the analysis and processing of multimedia data, including video, and the development of algorithms for robotics and automation. 

Therefore, the five most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are: cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO.
